page.title: 03CROOKHAM : AMENITIES
page.content: Despite its small size and population Crookham Village is favoured with good amenities. The inn is well patronised by young people travelling in by car. There is a social club built in 1920 where discos and dances take place. The annual children's Christmas party is held there. A miming play is performed outside the club every Boxing Day and a local fete is held in June every year. The village shop, Post Office and newsagents as well as the nearby farm shop have good local trade, especially as the bus service only runs twice a day. Crookham Village is twinned with Levignon, France and exchange visits take place between the two villages.
